“Consider This Marrow to Thy Bones”
For so long we have missed the point of sin in the action of blaspheming the Holy Spirit, the church must arise and wake and walk the walk we were called to. The Word blaspheme has several meanings, all of which center around one very solid theological conclusion. If you’re disobeying God”s Word in any form of deliberate action, you’re blasphing the Holy Spirit, the unforgivable sin! Mar 3:29 But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:

A primitive root; to scorn; or (Ecc_12:5) by interchange for H5132, to bloom: - abhor, (give occasion to) blaspheme, contemn, despise, flourish, X great, provoke.
1) to spurn, contemn, despise, abhor
1a) (Qal) to spurn, contemn
1 (Piel)
1b1) to spurn
1b2) to cause to contemn
1c) (Hiphil) to spurn
1d) (Hithpolel) to be contemned
(by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason): - X abundantly, X altogether, X at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, X greatly, X indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, X still, thank that which is not God.
to vilify; specifically to speak impiously: - (speak) blaspheme (-er, -mously, -my), defame, rail on, revile, speak evil.
1) to speak reproachfully, rail at, revile, calumniate, blaspheme
2) to be evil spoken of, reviled, railed at
A primitive root; to hack (with words), that is, revile: - blaspheme, reproach.
A primitive root; to be right (that is, correct); reciprocally to argue; causatively to decide, justify or convict: - appoint, argue, chasten, convince, correct (-ion), daysman, dispute, judge, maintain, plead, reason (together), rebuke, reprove (-r), surely, in any wise.
1. To speak of the Supreme Being in terms of impious irreverence; to revile or speak reproachfully of God, or the Holy Spirit. 1 Ki 21. Mark 3.
2. To speak evil of; to utter abuse or calumny against; to speak reproachfully of.

This particular one is my favorite description, as it covers the totality of the nature of the word: To speak out against the work of, labor of, existance of, to bring oneself or another to denying the work of or ceasing from the labor of The Holy Spirit
Let us examine this last description, with God’s Word as the substantiation. 1Ti 1:20 Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.
These two, were known for the argumntativeness and following after their fleshly desires. Jas 2:6 But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?
Jas 2:7 Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?
Jas 2:8 If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:
Jas 2:9 But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.
Jas 2:10 For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.
Jas 2:11 For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.
These scriptures, pretty much sum it all up, to break even one of these laws, is to commit a blasphemous act. Just a thought, but didn’t we discover the only unforgivable sin is to blaspheme the Holy Spirit? Then how is it the Word of God says, if you do not forgive, you will not be forgiven? Mat 6:15 But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
To not forgive someone is a blatant act of disrespect for God’s Word, an act of disobediance. Mat 6:15 But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

For those of us who were married by means of traditional vows, should remember one particular line in your vows, till death do you part. It was by no means of coincidence or fancy writing, these words were established in the wedding vows. Marriage is of God, established by God, ordained by God, thus the importance of this phrase. Should you, repent of your wilful disobediance, you will be forgiven. Mar 3:28 Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:
God in His awesome love, tender mercies, and grace, is always ready willing and able to forgive us our trespasses. To me this is great news and the kind of Father I want to love more and more and serve wholeheartedly, with a worshipful heart and an obedient spirit, all the days of my life.

How about you, isn’t this perfect God worth your everything?

Ministering to Ministers, or maybe just the true God seekers

Ministering to pastors or maybe just the true God seekers

"Obey your leaders and submit to them,
for they are keeping watch over your souls,
as those who will have to give an account.
Let them do this with joy and not with groaning,
for that would be of no advantage to you."
—Hebrews 13:17

Sit back and think about it - you want the best spiritual direction possible, but

are you taking that person for granted?

This article began with an e-mail from Curt Hendley, a dear friend in

ministry. Curt has developed a burden for encouraging ministers and he sent

this e-mail to 50 blogging ministers asking them to write something on how

congregants can encourage their ministers. Curt has now set up a permanent

page on his blog where he is compiling and linking to replies.

The fact that someone cares enough to ask pastors what would encourage them

is, in and of itself, a great encouragement. With that in mind, I sent the

following suggestions to Curt and offer them to you.

Take your own spiritual growth seriously

"Nice sermon pastor" and "you're a good pastor" are wonderful to hear but

what we really want to hear is that you are growing in your walk with Christ.

This is why we are in ministry, we want to see people come to Christ and grow

in Christ. We take your spiritual growth seriously and one of the greatest

encouragements to us is to see you taking it as seriously as we do.

Several years ago a group I was working with a group from our church that

was painting our rented facility. The pastor joined me in the room I was

working in and made the comment that he really enjoyed doing this painting

because he could see the results of his work immediately. He explained that in

ministry we don't really see the results of our work unless the numbers are

growing and budgets are increasing. Yet, ministers also know that increasing

numbers and budgets aren't the best measure of effectiveness and we know that

a lot of significant ministry can be going on where the growth is minimal.

But again, even where growth may be happening we don't often see it and

many of us struggle with whether or not we are really making a difference in

the lives of our folks. By taking your spiritual growth seriously you encourage

your minister that he is making a difference.

I’m writing to you and other blogging pastors because I have a question only a

pastor can answer. I’ve been growing increasingly aware of how difficult the

job of pastor can be. I know that pastors often receive a lot more criticism than

encouragement, and that can lead to all sorts of bad feelings. I think, though,

that most congregations truly love their pastors but don’t understand how

much encouragement is needed or how to practically provide that

encouragement. I also think that pastors are generally and understandably

reluctant to ask for such encouragement or display any human weakness at all.

I personally love my pastor, and I’m keenly aware of many things that beat

him down in his ministry. Most of those things are entirely out of my control

or influence. I would like to provide encouragement to him myself and incite

others to do so as well. But I know enough to know that I have no idea exactly

what issues a pastor faces that members of the congregation could alleviate. I

just don’t know what to do or how to go about providing the most effective

encouragement for him.

My request to you is that you respond with a blog post (or a link to a post if

you’ve already written one) listing some practical ways a congregation can

encourage their pastor. If you’re reticent about revealing that sort of thing on

your own blog, I would be happy to post something you write on my blog and

remove your name from it–sort of an "advice from an anonymous pastor" kind

of thing. I really want to know this, and I want the flock to stop being unaware

of their shepherd’s humanity and needs.

If you decide to write a post about this, please let me know so I can read it and

link to it.

Sincerely,
Curt Hendley
The Happy Husband
http://www.thehappyhusband.com

Being a Godly pastor must be the most difficult job in the world. CEOs of

corporations must weather attacks from competitors, and leaders of countries

must deal with other countries’ leaders as well as politicians within their own

countries, but pastors have to protect themselves, their families, and their

churches from attacks by Satan himself. The fact that so many pastors get little

love and support from their congregations goes a long way toward explaining

why so many pastors resign every day.

I’m collecting all the responses I get on this page. Please check out these links

and see how you can serve your pastor:

•Peter Bogert: "To me, the greatest encouragement in ministry takes place

when people connect with what I am preaching or teaching. Seeing a group of

people who are interested, alert, attentive—these things are what encourage a

pastor the most.…That being said, here are a few tangible and non-tangible

ways to encourage.…"
•Tod Bolsinger: "If you ask any of my executive staff, they will tell you of how

many people have come along side them, joined them in ministry and cared for

them personally. And it is my confidence in this community of people that

allows me to promise my staff that together we will all aim to have ‘a great

ministry and a great life.…‘
•Glenn Buzbee: "Churches can be like middle school. Or like playgrounds beset

by a handful of bullies. It only takes one or two kids on the playground to stand

up to the bullies and say ‘Stop! No more!’ God just may be calling you to be one

of those kids to stand up and speak out; but while it is scary to defy a bully in

your congregation (and even a best friend could be one) if you don’t, then who

will?…"
•Jason Dollar: "I do not want to come across as moaning about how neglected

the pastor is. But I do understand that pastors need encouragement, too. And

the more a pastor is encouraged, given that he is laboring for the glory of God

and not self, the better he will carry out his duties.…"
•Byron Harvey: "1) Be a friend to your pastor. 2) Ask me how I’m doing

sometime. 3) 3. Once in awhile, tell me how something I’ve done has made a

difference.…"
•Noel Heikkinen: "For me, [this question] takes more the form of ‘Things I Wish

People Knew.’ I think if these things were realized, more encouragement could

happen organically. …"
•Bowden McElroy: "For me, the no-agenda, our-treat, we-just-want-to-hang-

out-doing-what-you-like dinner and a ball game was the best. I think too many

pastors simply don’t have friends.…"
McElroy, part 2: "I said, "Be a friend". Now, Curt wants to know: how?…"
McElroy, part 3: "Forget it’s the pastor, is this someone you would invite for

coffee? Or, to play golf? Or, to just ‘hang out’? If yes, then pursue that

friendship like any other.…"
•Pat Morley: "If you want to connect with your pastor, the overarching idea is

don’t put demands on him. Instead, help him accomplish his mission. In that

way, you will be part of his ministry instead of the object of his ministry.…"
•Steve Pedersen: "My Pastors’ Prayer Group met today on a 30 foot sailboat.…I

asked the guys a question to start off our conversation: How can a

congregation encourage their pastor? The guys on the boat responded with

these ideas…"
•Pastor Russ: "Your pastor loves you. He cares about you. He prays for you. He

works hard for you. Reciprocate those things and you will find that even as he

ministers to you, that you are ministering to him.…"
•Mark Van Der Hurst: "What has my church done to encourage me? I have

shared this with several pastor friends and have had a blogger ask for some

ideas to encourage his pastor. So, here is my experience/feeble attempt at

talking about a time OUT.…"
•David Wayne (aka Jollyblogger): "1. Take your own spiritual growth seriously.

2. Give your best to the church, not your leftovers. 3. Remind him that you are

for him.…"
•Craig Williams: "Begin here, trust and respect, until we prove untrustworthy

or unreliable.…"

It's not the size of the congregation, numbers either reflect God in the

study of gemetria, or in most churches today, reflect the feather on ears effect

"Displaced Thinking"

“Displaced Thinking”

It has been brought to my attention as of late, through the Holy Spirit, that men, husbands are deceived through displaced thinking. Mar 12:24 Jesus told them, "Are you not deceived because you don't know the Scriptures or the power of God?
Granted, God did say the woman is the weaker vessel; 1Pe 3:7 Husbands, in the same way, live with your wives with understanding of their weaker nature yet showing them honor as co-heirs of the grace of life, so that your prayers will not be hindered.
What man in his right mind, would take occasion to lord over his wife? If the woman, as Adam said, is bone of my bone and flesh of my flesh, then the man would be out of the will of God, while actually lording over himself. This stupid man action however; does not give allowance or occasion for a woman to disrespect her husband. This wrongful action in fact should bring the woman to the throne of grace at the Lord’s feet, where the woman can make her request known. First the cry of her heart, even in her pain asking that the Lord’s will be done, then thanking Him for making it so. When a person continues to ask over and over and over, the same request, where is the faith in this action, so ask, believe, thank God and receive your answer, Heb 11:1 Now faith is the reality of what is hoped for, the proof of what is not seen.
Keep in mind, when Jesus said do not continue in vain prayers, Mat 6:7 When you pray, don't babble like the idolaters, since they imagine they'll be heard for their many words.
When women verses men, men for the most part lose in the communicative skills area, but; this is a good thing, as God loves to hear from His children. Remember though, if you talk too much, you cannot hear all that is said, when God speaks, it’s in the still small voice. Man was made in the image of God and women were made in the image of man, woman may have gotten the better deal, because the rib that woman was made from, comes from a place next to the heart. Maybe, women got the heart of God in the transfer, because men build Jericho walls around their hearts as a measure of protection. There in lays a prayer for women to pray for their men, ask that God tear down the Jericho walls of the man’s heart and fill it with His love. One other advantage of taking things to the Lord vs. man, Mar 10:27 Looking at them, Jesus said, "With men it is impossible, but not with God, because all things are possible with God."
There is nothing that the man can do to appease or fix any problem, but God is far more able and capable and yes, even willing to make things right and He will get the glory for it.
It is my earnest hope that you are blessed, because you put this into action, believing, that you will see good results.
1Co 11:3 But I want you to know that Christ is the head of every man, and the man is the head of the woman, and God is the head of Christ.
The scripture does not by any means negate the authority or leadership ability of women, it is the proper chain of command that God set up, and should be followed. Women, be the leader God called you to be, Esther rescued the house of Israel in leadership and you ,too can rescue your household in the same fashion! God bless each and every one of you as you apply, with love, the teaching.

How Impious our Thoughts

“ How Impious our Thoughts “

I can’t speak for others, but I know I’m not alone; 1Co 10:13 No temptation has overtaken you except what is common to humanity. God is faithful and He will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation He will also provide a way of escape, so that you are able to bear it.
Periodically, men and women in the 5 fold ministry go through things, we tell no one about as telling someone generally means weakness. This translates into speculation and even gossip from the body and from gossip to loss of hope within the flock. I’m here to let you know that if you’re not praying for the leadership in your church, you’re not being obedient to the whole Word of God. On the other hand, if the leadership is not requesting prayer from the flock as well as the other leadership, you’re walking in pride. Jas 5:16 Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.
Here’s a strange thought, one that is a little hard to swallow, but yet holds great truth, when God chastens you, He is showing you His love. Job 5:17 Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
Pro 3:11 My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:
Heb 12:5 And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:
Heb 12:7 If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?
Heb 12:11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.
Rev 3:19 As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.
2Sa 7:14 I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commit iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men:
Pro 19:18 Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
These are but a few verses whereby, some wish it wasn’t so, but; God is perfect and complete in all manner of things.
Now you have to, or at least should ask yourself, are you being fully and completely obedient to the Word of God. For the body, are you praying selfless prayers for your leadership, without any attached agendas? If you are not, you’re not only being disobediant to God, but you’re also being disrespectful to Him all all authority placed over you. Leadership over you does not necessarily cover in house or behind the pulpit. It includes; worship leaders, associate Pastors, Bishops, Prophets or Prophetesses, Apostles, Teachers, Evangelists, members of the worship team, program leaders, coffeshop personel, kitchen staff, and yes, even those in the helps category, right down to the person cleaning the toilets. Each of these people, are officers in God’s eyes and each of them needs a constant covering, with no personal agendas attached in prayer. Men and woman, the officers of God, especially the officers of God, are no better and no different than you or I, they need covering also. These men and women of God, lay their lives on the line everyday for you, and when you have a need, they’re there for you, to the best of their ability as frail human beings. How many times do you seek out one of these officers of God and ask for prayer for this or prayer for that, and they’re johnny on the spot to lift your needs up in prayer. How many times do they not just lift up your request, but they also ask God for the strength and peace to carry you through? Now, how many times have you ever ernestly asked them if they need prayer and you’ve carried through with a heart burdening fervency?
Let’s look at the otherside of the coin, I, being a Pastor, don’t ask for prayer, why; because I’m able to go to the Lord for my own needs. The other evening, the Lord got all over my case, chastening me, why; for being arogant and prideful. I’ve been going through somethings, heavy burdens, asking God to give me wisdom and understanding over what I’m going through and God brought more weight to bare, without explaination or direction. God the Father was virtually bringing down my house around me, I’m standing, I’m standing, I’m fighting and all to no avail. Then God spoke, and I didn’t like what I heard, He said I was being prideful, never asking for prayer, never relying on the body to care for the shephard. In other words, I was not showing my weakness in confession of need, nor was I trusting the body to stand up for me, in my hour of need. In my no trusting them, the God, Jesus in them, I was holding them back from their next level. How about it leaders, is that something you want to hear, I didn’t think so because I didn’t want to hear it either. If your leadership doesn’t ask for prayer, pray for them anyway, and leadership; if you’re not asking for prayer, is your pride standing in the way and causing your flock to not go to higher ground? 1Th 5:17 Pray without ceasing.
If you start praying one for another, you won’t have time to stop, you won’t have time to enter into sin, because praying can definitely keep you busy. Jas 5:16 Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.
Don’t just pray half heartedly either, the Lord God demands whole hearted attention in all things. Col 3:23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
Mat 6:6 But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
This message is as much to the leadership as it is to the flock; God wants all His children to be blessed, because he loves us that much, and because of Him, so do I!

What is your Faith?

“What is your Faith?”

1Co 2:9 But as it is written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love him.
Heb 11:1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
We had been having a revival at our church, I’m no spring chicken, but I was catching. There was a rather tall, well built young man, who seemed to be constantly getting in the way while presenting himself as a cather. It’s never a good thing to stand behind someone, in the way of others trying to handle the task of catching and allowing people to fall. Now there is a great discernable difference between a person going down in the flesh and one going down in the Spirit. I was there attending to my position every night, and every night, this man stood in the way of catchers till they got frustrasted and stopped trying to catch. After 3 weeks, it finally happened, he stood between me and the person I was trying to catch, so I ducked under him and proceeded to take my position in readiness. He grabbed me and threw me out of the way and I just retook my place again. Again, he threw me out of the way, I sort of looked at him, wondering what his problem was. I stood up and proceeded once again to try to take my position, then it happened, he pulled me away, turned me around and punched me in the chest.
A little history about me, I am a martial artist and though it sounds like brag, it’s not intended to be. I went 25 years in the ring, undefeated, I was the cruelest fighter of all. I was willing to die to win and my opponents could see it in m y eyes. Most of the time when that look came in my eyes, my opponents left the ring, because they knew from what they saw, I didn’t care about anything accept winning, no matter the cost!
Let’s return now to this fateful night, when he punched me, it was hard enough to drop me to my hands and knees. The dead man in me began to arise, and as I began to stand up, my mind filled with the thought patterns of my past. In the 1st second, I thought of how many ways do I know how to kill a man and which one would I use. In the 2nd second, my mind filled with an even worse vengeance of thoughts, how many different ways do I know how to hurt a man and leave him with a lifelong pain, so he would remember, never do this again. Then the 3rd second came, and as I looked up with death in my eyes and a hateful desire in my heart to inflict massive pain on this man, I heard the Holy Spirit clearly say, “who are you going to show?” I lowered my head and removed myself from the sanctuary and sat with my Pastor in the sound booth. My Pastor knew, something had happened, from the time I stood up till the time I looked at the man, wanting to cause him pain, he said, so what did He, meaning the Holy Spirit, say to you? During this period of time, my days were really long, I was getting up at 3AM, so I could spend time with the Lord before I went to work. From work, I would race home, grab something to eat, shower, shave, get dressed and return back to church, where I would be till idnight or after. My Pastor said it was time for me to get some rest, so I did, but I was awed and stunned at the same time, by the events that had just taken place. I praised God all the way home, got to see 1st hand in action, 1Jn 4:4 Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.
To my blessing, those words have stood in rememberance, everytime I run into similar circumstances, but now they are always before the flesh thoughts.
Recently, I had the occasion to see this man again at another church, there appeared to be no difference in his actions or demeanor. A couple of days ago, for no apparent reason, those words rang out loud again, causing me to ponder on everything that had taken place, until that new moment of thought. “Who are you going to show?”, made me wonder, not only about Whom I would choose to display that fateful night, but who actually did I show it to? The only person who actually saw my choice of whom to show was me and I was the only one effected by all events surrounding the many times those words were heard. Then the Lord led me back to a strange place in my mind, this is what He said, you have faith as big as a mountain for others, but you lack that faith for you. I am a visual person when it comes to my life and anything that directly surrounds my life. As an unsaved person, my life consisted of hatred and I lived for anger, anger was my drive and my focus. I could see the results of my anger and see them immediately, no matter the task, I got the desired results and anger was my fuel. That does not mean that everything I did was of an evil and hateful nature, it just means anger fueled my accomplishment quotient.
It was right here at this moment of clarity, I realized, I was still looking for that accompliment quotient, but instead of anger as the fuel, it had to be love as the fuel. This is where the Lord stepped into change my thought patterns and direct my footsteps correctly. He said, your fuel must be faith, while your foundation is love, and in this, hope is resurrected. 1Co 13:13 So these three things continue: faith, hope, and love. And the greatest of these is love.
God always, already had a plan in place, and if you have enough faith to believe God, He will show you and the Holy Spirit will teach you truth and no lie.

If God is working in your life and your letting Him, praise Him, His works are always perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
So what is your faith, before this moment, my faith was what I could see, but now, because of His immence love, He has taught me to take my faith, personally for me.

“When Jesus Looks “

“When Jesus Looks “
Did you ever have a moment when you stood in front of the mirror, when suddenly scripture jumped out at you
Did you ignore it, or did you aspire to live it?
The only one that can truly answer that would be God, for we know scripture states, the heart is deceitfully wicked, who can know it!

When Jesus looks upon my life ... ... ...

What picture does He see.
Does He see His own reflection,
Or does He just see me.

Does He see His likeness,

The product of His hand.
Or just another Christian,
Who never took a stand.

Does He see a child of God,

A child that He set free.
Living life to honor Him,
Or does He just see me.

What about the other folks,

I meet along the way.
Do I show them Jesus,
To brighten up their day.

When someone looks into my eyes,

Can they truly see.
That calm and gentle peace of God,
That dwells inside of me.

When I reach out and shake a hand,

Is He right there in my grip.
Can they feel that strength from God,
That steadies when I slip.

When folks are in my presence,

Do they know His Spirit's there.
Can they see that He's the one,
Who guides me everywhere.

When other people think of me,

What is on their mind.
Do they think of Jesus Christ,
So gentle and so kind.

I try to be like Jesus,

Every single day.
Spreading love and kindness,
All along my way.

I'm afraid that I have failed,

I could not pass the test.
Deep inside my heart I know,
I haven't done my best.

I have had to fight my flesh,

Since the day that I was born.
It's always causing trouble,
And being such a thorn.

That's why His Spirit dwells in me,

He's helping me to learn.
In every situation,
Where I need to turn.

He knew I'd never pass the test,

That's why He took my place.
He gave His life to save my soul,
He suffered my disgrace.

Now I try to be like Him,

I must present Him well.
So other folks will want His gift,
And turn their backs on hell.

Other folks should see the joy,

That Christ has given me.
They should want to have it too,
Especially since it's free.

Have We Really put on the Whole Armor of God?

“Have We Really put on the Whole Armour of God?”

Eph 6:10 Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.
Eph 6:11 Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
Eph 6:12 For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.
Eph 6:13 Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.
Eph 6:14 Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness;
Eph 6:15 And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;
Eph 6:16 Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.
Eph 6:17 And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:

As of late, I have been hearing and seeing, things from the Lord that have begun to bother me, and bother me deep, to the point of tears. God has been doing a healing in the body, but a healing that we have a tough time accepting and receiving, because He said it is concerning our secrets sins. In other words, sins that we are not aware of, they exist deep in our souls, as a result of past hurts. Generally, when God is showing something of this nature to His prophets and seers, He expects the prophets and seers to examine themselves or ask God to show them, the hurtful wicked things in them first. I am no different from anyone else, God not a respecter of persons, expects the same from me as He would anyone, everyone else. My sin, was throwing stones of truth on a situation, without standing in the authority given me, and when I was tired and worn, I did not cry out for help. Though I was throwing stones of truth at the situation, the only thing I was doing was burying the problem, while giving the problem time to root, hidden under all the stones I had thrown at it. 2Ti 3:5 Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away. This, on my part is not always fun, to expose myself, before men, but scriptural; Jam 5:16 Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much. How many of us really want to be that transparent for others to find fault and ridicule us for our failings, forgetting to examine ourselves? After confessing to God, the faults He showed me, He healed me, I saw a whirlwind rise up around the stones I had thrown at this problem, removing the stones, removing the dirt, then finally removing the root of this wicked thing. From this point, I knew it was my responsibility to walk in this healing and the POWER and AUTHORITY, Jesus extended to me, and this I do! The visions, the things I was hearing didn’t stop though, God next revealed the vanity of our ways, we wear this vanity as our breast plate. This vanity would be the faltered thinking and attitude of most of the bride. Faltered attitude, there is nothing wrong with me, I don’t need to be healed, faltered thinking, this hurt is my protection, my defense mechanism, so no one can ever hurt me again. In this state of mind and heart, we deny the power of God and His Word, electing to think we can do a better job of protecting ourselves than the unseen element, we call God. 2Ti 2:12 If we suffer, we shall also reign with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us:
The Word, Jesus the power and authority of the very character and nature of God is readying Himself to deny those who will not repent, receive, and walk in His whole suit of armor.

Eph 6:14 Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness;
How can you possibly have your loins girt with truth and have on His breastplate of righteousness, verses your breastplate of vanity, if you do not study His Word, if you do not renew your mind daily, if you’re not fully committed in total surrender, to His way alone.

Eph 6:15 And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;
How can you possibly stand in the midst of the storm in His peace He gives to you, if you don’t have His full gospel in you, so you know where and how to stand, when the time comes. Remember; 2Ti 4:2 Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine. Even if the one who needs to be reproved or rebuked is yourself!

Eph 6:16 Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.
Amazingly enough, we are misled once again to believe that if we simply have a little belief, we have faith, wrong, wrong, wrong is our thinking. Heb 11:1 Now Emunah is the substance of things for which we have tikvah. Emunah is the conviction of things not seen.
Properly translated; Now faith is the substance of things for which we have hope, faith is the convinced mind of seeing as real, that which is not seen. In other words, seeing that which has not yet produced as if it were already done, and in hand. If you can’t see it as in your hand or in action, how then do you call it faith, for faith is not the after effect or done deal.

Eph 6:17 And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:
The helmet of salvation is not something worn as man chooses to teach, from a one time act, it is a continual, day by day, moment by moment set of actions, established and affirmed, through every word that proceeds from God’s mouth. The sword of the Spirit is the Spirit of truth, the very character and nature of God, in whom we should find our likeness and image. Without God’s Word alive in us, how then can the flesh become Word, the reflection of Christ, the Word become flesh. The Word is more powerful than we can imagine, accompanied with the measure of faith we were given and; Jam 4:7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
To have the living Word of God in you, alive, alive, alive is part of submission to God. This is the way of speaking truth against the wiles of satan, putting his feeble attempts to constrain you unto his chains, to shame and nullified. What better victory, what better taste of all that is good and pure and holy, what an amazing adventure to getting intimate with our betrothed.

A new Christian has almost their every request filled by God, because they are a new Christian, and God wants to show them His love and power, but as Paul said; 1Co 13:11 When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
It is time to put away our childish attitudes, grow up, and take serious our God and His Word, lest He, the Word of God deny you, and you find yourself on the outside looking in; Mat 8:12 But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
God will grant you the power and strength, to do ALL He asked you to do, 1Ti 2:4 Who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.
God is a good God and is worth more alive to us in our hearts and souls, than any man could imagine, now Psa 34:8 O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

Revelation of Worship

“Revelation of Worship”

This morning, I awoke to a revelation of worship, a revelation that showed me, even my growth in the Lord. Eph 5:23 For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body. The worship leader serves in the role of the husband while each voice or collective of voices, serves as his bride, none above another, yet all in balance and perfect working harmony.
When I first came to the Lord, I could not sing or play music with any other person, as it would throw me off what I was trying to do. Why, because I had not yet learned the importance of working with others in harmony. I had to stand out, pride still ruled in my life and I had to be number one, even God Himself hadn’t registered in my spirit as the King of kings and Lord of lords in my life. This is something, mature Chrsitians should keep in mind, regarding new Christians, to give them mercy, remembering it’s the Holy Spirits job to clean the house or tabernacle of the new convert. As the Holy Spirit begins to gain reign in the heart of a person, they begin to settle down and step back, little by little, piece by piece until God / Jesus through the Holy Spirit is truly number one in the person’s life. No longer is it about blowing one’s own horn or establishing that person to be all that and a bag of chips, they have become pliable and humble. This is not to say they remain pliable and humble, for God through His Word said; Phi 2:12 Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling. This is a must, otherwise we become smug, arrogant, and of no good use for the Lord, Psa 131:1 <A Song of degrees of David.> LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.
Psa 131:2 Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child. Pro 18:12 Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
Each instrument and each voice of worship is crucial in its application to the mix of voices and instruments, to the harmony of the music, to the whole worship of the heart. Each voice and each instrument works together in harmony and unity, the same way as the members of a marriage are to be. Christ being the head, the worship leader being the husband, the singers being the bride and the instruments being the children. Volume wise, the worship leader would be above the rest, but at the same time, the harmony to the lead is equal in its volume, never above the voice of the worship leader, as the harmony is supporting in its role. If you have ever listened to a well trained choir, there is a lead singer, there is / are harmonic singers, and there are accompaniment singers. It is just as important for the collective volume of the accompaniment singers to be the same or slightly less than that of the lead singer. Have you ever noticed that the harmonic singers are the same volume as the lead singer? It’s due to the fact they serve as a supporting role of no less volume or value as the lead singer. Gen 2:18 And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him. The word meet actually means the same as, equal support, not someone less than, not someone to abuse, not valueless in God’s eyes, God sees the bride as an equal representation of the husband, especially in the husbands absence. Mat 19:5 And said, For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?
If the two are one flesh, then they stand on equal grounds and equal terms, if they are both walking correctly with the Lord! So, harmony is the bride and harmony, whether one voice or many is equal in volume to that of the worship leader. Why, because they are singing the same thing, whether words or meaning as the worship leader, but in different harmonic aspect, bringing in unity, harmony, peace, and pleasantry. The instruments, they are like children and no child should be considered less important than another, and unless it’s a moment for one child to shine above the rest, all instruments should work together for the glory of God. Each instrument, like a child should be considered equal in its role to the whole, balance is so key here in order for this to work correctly. Rom 8:28 And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose. Now I realize this scripture may seem somewhat out of place in this context, but it is not in the bigger scheme of things. Even instruments were called to honor God and those playing the instruments must fundamentally express their love of the lord through the talent they were given to honor Him. If one instrument is louder than another, it drowns out the rest even to the point of depleting or denying key notes and sounds from other instruments to shine in the ability to honor God. All things in worship must work together in perfect balance and harmony to accomplish perfect worship and if the worship leader, the worship team, and the instruments of worship are in perfect harmony, volume, and balance, then the body of worshipers will follow. This in turn will bring in the glory of God, even to the point of the ministers inability to stand in His presence.
I said all this to show, we must work together in perfect harmony and balance, for if just one voice or one instruments maintains an exalted status in worship, then it’s out of order with God and is a strange fire before the Lord. 1Co 14:40 Let all things be done decently and in order. Bring your offering to His house in proper order and standing and God bless your every effort to be harmonically balance in your worship. Remember, whether growth is slow or desirously hungry for the Lord, we are all instruments of worship and until the heart of another is surrendered fully to the Lord, do not condemn them as they learn to walk a worshipful walk with the Lord. Remember where you came from and how understanding and merciful the Lord has been with you as you became a worshiper from a humble heart! We are all children of God who NEED to be raised up in His ways in order to perform His music.

Have you Witnessed the change

“Have you Witnessed the Change”

If the Lord stood before you or you stood before Him and He asked you, what about you has changed, what would you answer Him? Last night, that very thing happened to me, and I found myself somewhat dumbstruck by this question, except for a hope inside me that somehow, someway Jesus was and is the new creation in my life, I really had no HONEST answer that I could give. 2Co 5:17 Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new. I had no words that I could in all honesty speak to Him, just thoughts from His Word; Eph 4:24 And that ye put on the new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness. and; Col 3:10 And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him: I read and study His Word with an earnest desire to know Him more intimately, to renew my mind daily; Rom 12:2 And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God. I am constantly communing with Him, in prayer, in gratitude, in conversation, in worship, and in meditation; but is there really a change in me, worth value enough to say, yes Lord, there is a change. Jer 17:9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it? Still, there is a confident hope, that I have surrendered fully to Christ, so then how does one know they are not walking in the vanity of their own mind? Pro 15:28 The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
Then it happened, the Lord answered me, and of all the ways I could respond, I found myself praising and thanking Him for what He said. Before He answered me, he took me on a journey through my past, to show and build a confidence in me, that He the Lord is in charge in my life and that He is the Lord in my life.
This is an account of what I saw and heard; before coming to the Lord, before even knowing there was a God or savior, anger ruled my life. My life before Christ, was fueled by the things that took place in my childhood that caused me to grow into the most angry of people. With hatred as my backbone and anger as my confidence, there was nothing I could not do or get accomplished, and I was as Esau who built his own kingdom. Mal 1:3 And I hated Esau, and laid his mountains and his heritage waste for the dragons of the wilderness.
When I finally answered the call of the drawing of the Holy Spirit and as I stepped out of God’s way, God would tear down my walls and parapets, brick by brick and stone by stone, until He was able to give me a heart of flesh. Eze 11:19 And I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you; and I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them an heart of flesh: Eze 36:26 A new heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put within you: and I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you an heart of flesh. All through the time of my walk, I have been faced with adversity that would cause the backbone of hatred and the confidence of my anger to rise. This would once again build shields, walls, parapets of self protection, but every time, the wall was a little lower and a lot weaker. As each event took place and anger would rise in me, I would justify myself with the scripture; Eph 4:26 Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:
Unless it is God’s justification what we wear is a robe of self righteousness, God gave me a word to walk by at the beginning of this year, as He has done for the past few years. This year, the word He gave me was, “get real, be real, stay real”, and so I did to the best of my understanding. What God has been able to do with me this year has been a miraculous marvel to me. Recently, once again I was assaulted for asking a question, regarding a preaching someone had put out there. This person responded to my question in the same fashion that I used to respond, anger and hatred. I had challenged what they wrote and I apparently offended them, by not accepting their teaching, but in my questioning them, I was doing nothing more or less than the Word of God says to do; 2Ti 2:15 Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
At the end of the encounter with this person, I found myself praying, asking God to protect anyone that might be hurt or even killed in their faith, by this person’s anger. I also found myself praying for this person soul, while speaking out against the unrighteous attitude that was displayed. I actually felt a genuine love and concern for this person’s soul and compassion for anyone else this person might inflict the attitude on that this person tried to inflict on me.
The Lord said to me, I have succeeded in giving you a heart of flesh, filled with My love and My compassion for the things and ways of God.
